content.description: I did a sit start on the left side of the west face and climbed up and slightly to the right.
content.location: This boulder is located in the west side of the pit, near Commerce Road.

content.description: I started below the tree thats is on top of the boulder and went up and slightly to the right.
content.location: This boulder is near the west side of the pit and has a tree with two trunks on top of it.

content.description: Started right in the center of the face, plenty of starting footholds/handholds
content.location: Theres a rocky outcrop in the center of The Pit that has a large burn mark on the north facing side of the rock. This route was directly East of the burn mark, still on the rocky outcrop.

content.description: I started in the center of the rock pictured, I ended up going slightly to the left as I got up higher and ran into a tree root. The root was loose and not good to put weight on so I would recommend not using it. Decent hand holds, and not many loose stones. Very easy to get back to the bottom of The Pit when you top out.
content.location: If you enter The Pit from the west and are walking east, there will be a large area when you first enter that has a rocky outcrop in the center, surrounded by various levels of rock walls. Route 1 is on the north side of the outer rock walls, slightly opposite of the large burn mark on the rocky outcrop in the center.

content.description: Used the lower right section of the boulder for my feet, and then climbed up a shallow slab from the right to the top.
content.location: The boulder was a little past and to the right of "Route 1".

content.description: Just use the little cracks and go up.

Slightly south of the main Vermillion river canyon in Hastings is a dry canyon that used to drain water from nearby fields (or at least thats the hearsay I got about it while living in town). There are some exposed rock walls of the sides of the dry canyon that are decent for bouldering.
